intro: Sida clandestina, commonly known as the "secret sida," is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, pale green leaves. Its flowers are typically pink or purple, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. Sida clandestina is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in coastal areas due to its tolerance for saline conditions.
